text: divagations of her 'poor brother- so she constantly referred to him- there were a hundred reasons why it would be objectionable to have the family history exposed. Whatever latitude she allowed in the warmth of her kindly nature to others -or to herself - she believed implicitly in the moral code she had learned from her good grandmother, the Countess of Holderness, living in a well-ordered Derbyshire manor.
